Author: phm87#7395
Content: I see the KMD active user reward as a negative transaction fee. If you perform a tx with KMD, if you wanted few hours/days before moving/sending the coin, you won't pay tx fees (and you gain some tiny amounts because the active user reward is above tx fee). In some cases, the KMD user won't claim his active user reward (ledger users that don't use the special tool to claim rewards) then the value will go in the tx fees for miners (miners will gain this amount not claimed)

Content: I still don't understand it. Where does the KMD i claim come from? There is a fixed supply of 200M of which 110M is mined and in circulation. I hold amount x, who pays for my extra 5% * X?

Author: phm87#7395
Content: it is added to the circulation and it comes from nowhere (thin air) or math. If someone wants to have some KMD, he can mine it on a pool or he can claim his reward regularly. Both are new coins added to circulation

Author: phm87#7395
Content: if the user funds are eligible to claim their reward, user moves funds but without claiming (it can happen using ledger or similar devices if you don't use the proper tool), then the unclaimed reward is added to Komodo reward for the miner (or the notary node)

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Notary nodes are mining KMD blocks, around 75% of blocks. About 25% of blocks are mined by equihash mining pools

Content: if you search through the KMD explorer, you'll see some blocks with higher block rewards

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
`How about that 5% annual staking reward, how does that work then?`
@CoinKing88 Part of the problem with you understanding how it works is not understanding the terminology behind it and the terminology you are using.
There is no staking in KMD.
KMD does have a "usage reward" where you get a bonus reward for *using* it.
Merely sending a transaction that meets certain rules allows you to earn this reward.
Staking requires you to actively produce a block.
These are completely different things.
The user rewards don't "come from" x or y, they are created with the transaction at the time of the transaction.
The amount that users get as a reward does not exist before the user gets the reward.
The rewards are created by the protocol as a form of emission.
